## type [Model](<https://github.com/aschey/bubbleprompt/blob/main/input/simpleinput/model.go#L15-L17>)

A Model is an input for handling simple token\-based inputs without any special parsing required.

```go
type Model[T any] struct {
    // contains filtered or unexported fields
}
```

### func [New](<https://github.com/aschey/bubbleprompt/blob/main/input/simpleinput/model.go#L20>)

```go
func New[T any](options ...Option[T]) *Model[T]
```

New creates new a model.

### func \(\*Model\[T\]\) [Blur](<https://github.com/aschey/bubbleprompt/blob/main/input/simpleinput/model.go#L147>)

```go
func (m *Model[T]) Blur()
```

Blur removes the focus from the input.

### func \(\*Model\[T\]\) [CurrentToken](<https://github.com/aschey/bubbleprompt/blob/main/input/simpleinput/model.go#L59>)

```go
func (m *Model[T]) CurrentToken() input.Token
```

CurrentToken returns the token under the cursor.

### func \(\*Model\[T\]\) [CurrentTokenBeforeCursor](<https://github.com/aschey/bubbleprompt/blob/main/input/simpleinput/model.go#L65>)

```go
func (m *Model[T]) CurrentTokenBeforeCursor() string
```

CurrentTokenBeforeCursor returns the portion of the token under the cursor that comes before the cursor position.

### func \(\*Model\[T\]\) [CursorIndex](<https://github.com/aschey/bubbleprompt/blob/main/input/simpleinput/model.go#L160>)

```go
func (m *Model[T]) CursorIndex() int
```

CursorIndex returns the cursor index in terms of number of unicode characters. Use this to calculate input lengths in terms of number of characters entered.

### func \(\*Model\[T\]\) [CursorOffset](<https://github.com/aschey/bubbleprompt/blob/main/input/simpleinput/model.go#L154>)

```go
func (m *Model[T]) CursorOffset() int
```

CursorOffset returns the visual offset of the cursor in terms of number of terminal cells. Use this for calculating visual dimensions such as input width/height.

### func \(\*Model\[T\]\) [Focus](<https://github.com/aschey/bubbleprompt/blob/main/input/simpleinput/model.go#L115>)

```go
func (m *Model[T]) Focus() tea.Cmd
```

Focus sets the keyboard focus on the editor so the user can enter text.

### func \(\*Model\[T\]\) [Focused](<https://github.com/aschey/bubbleprompt/blob/main/input/simpleinput/model.go#L120>)

```go
func (m *Model[T]) Focused() bool
```

Focused returns whether the keyboard is focused on the input.

```go
func (m *Model[T]) Init() tea.Cmd
```

Init is part of the Input interface. It should not be invoked by end users.

### func \(\*Model\[T\]\) [ResetValue](<https://github.com/aschey/bubbleprompt/blob/main/input/simpleinput/model.go#L137>)


### func \(\*Model\[T\]\) [Runes](<https://github.com/aschey/bubbleprompt/blob/main/input/simpleinput/model.go#L132>)

```go
func (m *Model[T]) Runes() []rune
```

Runes returns the raw text entered by the user as a list of runes. This is useful for indexing and length checks because doing these operations on strings does not work well with some unicode characters.

### func \(\*Model\[T\]\) [SetCursor](<https://github.com/aschey/bubbleprompt/blob/main/input/simpleinput/model.go#L165>)


Set cursor sets the cursor position.

SetCursorMode sets the mode of the cursor.

### func \(\*Model\[T\]\) [Tokens](<https://github.com/aschey/bubbleprompt/blob/main/input/simpleinput/model.go#L82>)

```go
func (m *Model[T]) Tokens() []input.Token
```

Tokens returns the tokenized input. This includes delimiter tokens.

### func \(\*Model\[T\]\) [TokensBeforeCursor](<https://github.com/aschey/bubbleprompt/blob/main/input/simpleinput/model.go#L94>)

```go
func (m *Model[T]) TokensBeforeCursor() []input.Token
```

TokensBeforeCursor returns the tokenized input up to the cursor position. This includes delimiter tokens.

### func \(\*Model\[T\]\) [WordTokenValues](<https://github.com/aschey/bubbleprompt/blob/main/input/simpleinput/model.go#L71>)

```go
func (m *Model[T]) WordTokenValues() []string
```

WordTokenValues returns the tokenized input text. This does not include delimiter tokens.

```go
func (m *Model[T]) WordTokens() []input.Token
```

WordTokens returns the tokenized input. This does not include delimiter tokens.

```go
func (m *Model[T]) WordTokensBeforeCursor() []input.Token
```

WordTokensBeforeCursor returns the tokenized input up to the cursor position. This does not include delimiter tokens.

## type [Option](<https://github.com/aschey/bubbleprompt/blob/main/input/simpleinput/option.go#L17>)

```go
type Option[T any] func(settings *settings[T])
```

### func [WithDelimiterRegex](<https://github.com/aschey/bubbleprompt/blob/main/input/simpleinput/option.go#L19>)

```go
func WithDelimiterRegex[T any](delimiterRegex string) Option[T]
```

<details><summary>Example</summary>
<p>

```go
package main

import (
	"github.com/aschey/bubbleprompt/input/simpleinput"
)

func main() {
	// Use period-delimited tokens instead of whitespace-delimited tokens
	simpleinput.New(
		simpleinput.WithDelimiterRegex[any](`\s*\.\s*`),
	)
}
```

</p>
</details>

```go
func WithFormatter[T any](formatter parser.Formatter) Option[T]
```

```go
func WithLexerOptions[T any](options ...lexerinput.Option[T]) Option[T]
```

### func [WithSelectedTextStyle](<https://github.com/aschey/bubbleprompt/blob/main/input/simpleinput/option.go#L31>)

```go
func WithSelectedTextStyle[T any](style lipgloss.Style) Option[T]
```

### func [WithTokenRegex](<https://github.com/aschey/bubbleprompt/blob/main/input/simpleinput/option.go#L25>)

```go
func WithTokenRegex[T any](tokenRegex string) Option[T]
```

<details><summary>Example</summary>
<p>

```go
package main

import (
	"github.com/aschey/bubbleprompt/input/simpleinput"
)

func main() {
	// Use period-delimited tokens instead of whitespace-delimited tokens
	simpleinput.New(
		simpleinput.WithTokenRegex[any](`[^\s\.]+`),
	)
}
```

</p>
</details>
